Author: unicorn_pianos
Text: Yes it’s like a parasite inside my brain with its own separate intentions and voice. I differentiate between my own thoughts and Ed’s but I hate that hearing terrible things. Thank you. Only the first session is covered so I’m not sure what I’ll do. I’ve been in recovery for a year and it’s been full of ups and downs, I know this down is temporary but it doesn’t make it suck any less. Thanks for your response ❤️ I’ve been feeling too alone lately

Author: speakofthewolf
Text: This reminds me of how in NA (narcotics anon) a thing that is often repeated is that "the addiction speaks to you". EDs also speak to us. Like how you have self-awareness yet your ED is whispering all these messed up lies to you. I feel the same way and it makes me feel actually crazy.  &#x200B;  It's awful, I'm sorry. :( Good luck with your new dietitian, I hope things work out well for you and I hope you can enjoy food some day soon, like really enjoy it without the ED standing over your shoulder.
